compliant.section: Account information: We collect data when users create or update their Uber account or place an order through the guest checkout feature. compliant.section: When we transfer user data from the European Economic Area, the UK and Switzerland, we do so in accordance with the following, as necessary to perform the agreement with the user, consent, adequacy decisions regarding the country of transfer (see here, here, or here), and standard contractual clauses adopted by the European Commission (and equivalent clauses approved by the UK and Switzerland) and transfer mechanisms such as the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield Framework ("EU-U.S. Privacy Shield"), the UK extension to the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield and the Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield Framework ("Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield"), as set forth by the U.S. Department of Commerce.

compliant.section: UTI has certified to the U.S. Department of Commerce that it adheres to the (1) EU-U.S. Privacy Shield Principles: for the processing of personal data received from European Economic Area member countries in reliance on the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield, and the UK extension to the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield; and (2) Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield Principles: for the processing of personal data received from Switzerland in reliance on the Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield. If there is any conflict between this statement and the Principles, the Principles shall govern. If the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield or Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield becomes invalid, Uber will transfer data in accordance with the other data transfer mechanisms described above that are compliant with those certifications.
compliant.legal provisions: The transfer of personal data to a third country or an international organization shall be subject to the conditions laid down in this Chapter and shall only be allowed if, inter alia, the third country or international organization ensures an adequate level of protection.

Scope: Uber's Privacy Shield certification applies to personal data originating from the EEA (European Economic Area), the UK or Switzerland.
compliant.legal provisions: This Regulation applies to the processing of personal data wholly or partly by automated means and to the processing other than by automated means of personal data which forms part of a filing system or is intended to form part of a filing system.

compliant.section: Access: Users have the right to access personal data subject to Uber's Privacy Shield certification. For information on how to exercise this right, see "Choices and Transparency" above.
compliant.legal provisions: The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the controller confirmation as to whether or not personal data concerning him or her are being processed, and, where that is the case, access to the personal data and the following information.

compliant.section: Subsequent Transfers: Uber is responsible for the transfer of personal data to third parties, but only to those that are Privacy Shield certified. For information on the parties to whom Uber may transfer personal data, see "Data Sharing and Disclosure" above.
compliant.legal provisions: The controller shall be responsible for and be able to demonstrate compliance with this Regulation. The processor shall process the personal data only on documented instructions from the controller, including with regard to the purposes of the processing.

compliant.section: Law Enforcement Data Requests: Uber is required by applicable law to share user data, including data subject to Uber's Privacy Shield certification, pursuant to legal process or government request (including law enforcement requests).
compliant.legal provisions: Processing is necessary for compliance with a legal obligation to which the controller is subject. Processing is necessary for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest or in the exercise of official authority vested in the controller.

compliant.section: Investigations and Enforcement: Uber is subject to the investigatory and enforcement powers of the U.S. Federal Trade Commission.
compliant.legal provisions: Uber must cooperate with supervisory authorities and provide information to individuals upon request. Uber must provide individuals with a right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority. Individuals have the right to an effective judicial remedy against a supervisory authority's decision.

compliant.section: Questions and Disputes. In accordance with the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield, the UK extension to the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield and the Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield, Uber commits to resolving complaints about our collection and use of your personal information related to the Privacy Shield Principles. Riders and delivery partners can contact Uber here, and drivers and delivery partners can contact Uber here, to learn about our compliance with these Principles. They can also refer a complaint to their local data protection authority, and Uber will cooperate with that authority to resolve the complaint. As described in Appendix I to the Privacy Shield Principles, the Privacy Shield provides a right to invoke binding arbitration to resolve complaints not resolved by other means.
compliant.legal provisions: The data processing must be necessary for the performance of a contract to which the data subject is party or in order to take steps at the request of the data subject prior to entering into a contract. The data processor must be subject to binding and enforceable obligations to protect the personal data.

compliant.section: Users can learn more about the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield and Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield by viewing the Privacy Shield here, and to view Uber's certification, including the scope of data covered by our certification, see here.
